work.title: PHP Backend Developer
work.description: I worked as a PHP backend developer working with the Laravel framework to develop API's. I learned a lot about working in an international team and deploying applications to production.

work.title: Internship Tech Hub
work.description: In my third year of college I wanted to do an internship to get more familiar with how working in a big organisation is like. Wehkamp, a big online retailer of fashion and living in my hometown Zwolle, seemed like a good fit. For my internship, I compared multiple static site generation frameworks in order to research how Wehkamp can use this technology for their website. I made a custom built version of their existing tech blog on Medium using Gatsby as a proof of concept.

work.title: Graduation project
work.description: In my fourth and final year it was time for me to graduate. Because I did a summer school at Quintor, it also felt like a good fit to do my graduation project there. I chose to do a project in which I would research how the teams could do projects better with the goal of providing a better service for the clients. Based on the results of the research, I developed a full stack web application with ASP.NET Core, Entity Framework and React in which the teams could calculate the quality of their project and get insights on how they can improve.

education.title: Bsc Technical Computer Science
education.description: I wanted to study something technical. I already coded during high school as a hobby and for small clients, so studying Technical Computer Science at the Unversity of Twente (which is around 60 minutes by train from where I live) seemed like a good choice for me. The Computer Science subjects were not too difficult, however the education has a strong mathematical foundation. Because this was my weak spot I wasn't able to get the required points in order to continue this study. That's why I had to find something else.

education.title: HBO-ICT
education.description: I didn't want to give up on an education in IT, because it was my passion. I could have gone to a different university, but I wanted to study closer to home. That's why I chose to go to Windesheim which is a university of applied sciences. I really liked the more practical approach and the way of teaching as compared to a regular university. I ultimately chose to graduate in the field of software engineering.
